content.webTitle: Is broadband worthwhile or just expensive and corrupting?

fields.headline: Is broadband worthwhile or just expensive and corrupting?
fields.bodyText: Every week a Guardian Money reader submits a question, and it's up to you to help him or her out – a selection of the best answers will appear in next Saturday's paper. This week's question My sister refuses to have broadband at home, claiming it's too costly and corrupting. I feel this is unfair on her children, particularly when it comes to their homework, and I have offered to pay for it. Should I try to persuade her to take up my offer, or has she got a point? What do you think?
